div.div:
Improves shopping page layout and error handling
Enhances the shopping categories page with better visual design using card components and improved spacing. Adds a more user-friendly error state with an icon and navigation button to help users return home when categories fail to load.
Updates the grid layout to be more responsive and replaces plain text links with styled card components for better user experience.

Refactors product detail page to use product names instead of IDs
Changes API integration from fetching by product ID to searching by product title, improving URL readability and user experience.
Removes inline StarRating component in favor of reusable utility function from shared library.
Adds back navigation button and improves layout styling with better spacing and responsive design.
Updates error handling and loading states to reflect the new search-based approach.
Adds legacy behavior to category links for improved compatibility
Refactors navigation links to use legacy behavior for improved compatibility

Refactors breadcrumb component for better UX and performance
Simplifies the breadcrumb implementation by removing dropdown functionality and complex state management in favor of a cleaner, more accessible design.
Improves visual hierarchy with better spacing, typography, and hover states while adding smart path collapsing for long URLs to prevent UI overflow.
Enhances accessibility with proper ARIA patterns and keyboard navigation support, and optimizes performance by eliminating unnecessary API calls and state updates.

Adds product detail page with image gallery and reviews
Creates a comprehensive product detail view that fetches product data from API and displays complete product information including pricing, availability, and customer reviews.
Implements image gallery with thumbnail selection, star rating component for reviews, breadcrumb navigation, and responsive layout. Handles loading states, error handling, and currency formatting integration.
Supports discount pricing display, stock availability indicators, shipping/warranty information, and minimum order quantity details.

Simplifies provider structure and adds theme support
Removes multiple nested context providers and replaces them with a streamlined setup focused on essential functionality.
Adds ThemeProvider with class attribute support, light default theme, and system theme detection to enable dark/light mode switching.
Retains CurrencyProvider and introduces NotFoundProvider while removing Auth, Customer, Product, Wishlist, Payment, and Cart providers to reduce complexity.
Improves code documentation with JSDoc annotations explaining component purpose and parameters.

Simplifies layout structure and consolidates components
Removes multiple wrapper providers and consolidates navigation components into a single Header component.
Streamlines the component hierarchy by eliminating NotFoundProvider and ThemeProvider wrappers while moving theme management to the Providers component.
Updates styling with relative positioning and adjusted margins for better layout control.

Adds product grid component with currency formatting
Creates a responsive grid layout for displaying products with proper image handling and navigation links.
Integrates currency context to format prices according to user preferences, improving internationalization support.
Implements hover effects and responsive design that adapts from single column on mobile to four columns on extra large screens.

Adds currency status indicator component
Provides visual feedback for currency rate loading states and error handling.
Displays a spinning loader with "Loading rates..." text during data fetching and shows an error icon with retry button when rate updates fail.
Improves user experience by making currency operations more transparent and recoverable.

Refactors currency context with improved API handling
Simplifies currency management by removing complex tax-related functionality and consolidating currency operations into a cleaner interface.
Improves exchange rate fetching with better error handling and automatic fallback to static rates when API is unavailable or fails.
Streamlines the currency data structure and reduces dependencies on external constants while maintaining all core conversion and formatting capabilities.

Enhances UI components with modern variants and styling
Expands badge, button, dropdown menu, and select components with comprehensive variant systems including modern, minimal, glass, and professional styling options.
Adds size variants and improved accessibility features with proper focus states, hover effects, and animation support.
Replaces React Icons with Lucide React icons for consistency and updates import organization for better code structure.
Introduces variant-based styling using class-variance-authority for better maintainability and design system coherence.

Adds forbidden access error page
Provides users with clear feedback when attempting to access unauthorized resources.
Includes navigation back to home page for better user experience.

Adds core library utilities and navigation structure
Establishes foundational TypeScript utilities including class name merging, string formatting functions, and comprehensive type definitions for products, users, and UI components.
Creates navigation configuration supporting multi-level dropdown menus for travel booking, trip planning, and content discovery features.
Updates interface definitions to align with DummyJSON API structure while maintaining backward compatibility for existing components.

Remove unused navigation components
Cleans up codebase by eliminating navigation-related UI components that are no longer needed, including footer, sidebar navigation elements, and navigation menu primitives.
Reduces bundle size and simplifies the component structure.

Updates project configuration and dependencies
Migrates from Tailwind config file to inline configuration and switches from slate to neutral color scheme for better design consistency.
Updates icon library reference to correct package name and reorganizes import statements for better code organization.
Streamlines Next.js configuration by removing experimental features, environment variables, and bundle analyzer setup while expanding image host allowlist for broader external image support.
Adds Lucide React icons package and updates multiple dependencies to latest versions for improved performance and security.
Enhances TypeScript configuration with comprehensive path mappings for better import organization and developer experience.

Refactors theme toggle from switch to button component
Moves ThemeToggle component to buttons directory and replaces Switch UI with Toggle button for better UX.
Improves accessibility with proper aria-labels and screen reader support.
Optimizes performance by memoizing toggle button content to prevent unnecessary re-renders.
Enhances styling with better hover states and focus management for improved user interaction.

Adds shopping category page with navigation grid
Creates a new shopping landing page that displays product categories in a responsive grid layout. Users can browse and navigate to different shopping sections including men's and women's clothing, electronics, and jewelry.
Provides clear category descriptions and intuitive navigation to enhance the shopping experience.

Refactors vehicle data handling to use asynchronous fetching
Implements asynchronous data fetching for vehicle information instead of relying on mock data.
Updates state management to handle loading states and errors during data retrieval.
Refactors various computations and filtering logic to interact with the fetched vehicle data, ensuring a more dynamic and responsive application.

Fetch tours data from mock API instead of static data
Implements data fetching for tours using a mock API, replacing static data.
Updates state management to handle loading and error scenarios.
Adjusts filtering logic to utilize fetched tours data for dynamic filtering options.

Fetches hotel data from a mock API
Implements data fetching for hotel information using a mock API.
Replaces the use of hardcoded mock hotels with dynamic data retrieval, enhancing the component's flexibility and maintainability.
Updates filtering and pricing calculations to utilize the fetched hotel data instead of static values.

Refactors flight data handling to use async fetching
Improves the Flights and FlightDetails pages by replacing the static mock flight data with an asynchronous fetch from a data source.
Enhances user experience by implementing a loading state while flight details are being retrieved.
Updates the rendering logic to ensure the application reacts correctly to the fetched flight data.
Fixes potential issues with direct data manipulation and prepares the application for future integrations with real flight data APIs.

Refactors destination data handling to use async fetching
Updates the destination details and general destination pages to replace mock data with asynchronous fetching of destination-related data.
Implements state management for loading and error handling during data fetching, enhancing the user experience.
This change allows for dynamic data retrieval, improving scalability and maintainability of the codebase.

Fetches attractions data and updates state management
Implements data fetching for attractions using a mock API.
Replaces static mock data with dynamic data from the API, enhancing the application’s responsiveness to data updates.
Updates state management to handle loading states and integrates the fetched data into the filtering logic for improved user experience.

Refactors attraction loading to use asynchronous fetching
Updates the attraction details page to fetch attractions asynchronously instead of using a mock data array.
Implements loading state management and error handling during data fetching.
Replaces instances of the hardcoded mock data with dynamically fetched attractions, enhancing flexibility and maintaining up-to-date information.
Improves overall code structure and readability by utilizing state management for attractions and the current attraction.

Refactors activity and tour data fetching in ActivityDetailsPage
Updates the ActivityDetailsPage to replace mock data with asynchronous data fetching for activities and tours.
Implements loading state management while data is being fetched and optimizes activity selection based on the fetched data.
This change enhances the component's responsiveness and prepares it for integration with real data sources.

Refactors user data fetching in rewards page
Updates the rewards page to fetch user data asynchronously instead of using mock data directly.
Introduces loading state management to enhance user experience while data is being retrieved.
Updates the user data state once the current user information is loaded, ensuring accurate representation of rewards and points.

Adds trip and budget statistics retrieval and loading state
Implements fetching and displaying trip and budget statistics for users in the dashboard.
Introduces state management for trip and budget stats, including total trips, completed trips, total spent, and budget achievements.
Implements a loading state to enhance user experience while data is being fetched.
Refines displayed information to accurately represent trip completion and budget achievements.

Adds user-specific trip fetching and loading state
Implements data fetching for user trips using `getTripsByUser`, enhancing the user experience by displaying a loading state while the trips are being retrieved.
Filters completed and upcoming trips based on their end dates, improving the accuracy of displayed past trips.

Adds trip fetching and loading state to MyTripsSection
Implements data fetching for user trips in MyTripsSection.
Introduces loading state to improve user experience while trips are being retrieved.
Handles potential errors during the fetching process and displays a loading indicator.
Updates trip filtering logic to utilize fetched trips.

Refactors favorites page to use typed state management
Updates the FavoritesPage component to utilize TypeScript interfaces for better type safety in state management.
Replaces generic `any[]` types with specific types for users, hotels, flights, tours, destinations, attractions, activities, and vehicles.
Enhances code clarity and maintainability by ensuring type consistency throughout the component's state and filtering logic.
Additionally, introduces a loading state UI to improve user experience during data fetching.

Adds data fetching for user budgets and trips
Implements data retrieval for user budgets and trips using asynchronous calls.
Introduces loading state handling to improve user experience during data fetching.
Ensures fallback on error by resetting state and displaying loading indicators.
Enhances the component's responsiveness to user context changes.

Adds data fetching for favorites page using mock APIs
Implements state management and data fetching for users, hotels, flights, tours, destinations, attractions, activities, and vehicles on the favorites page.
Utilizes mock API functions to retrieve data asynchronously and updates the component state accordingly.
Enhances user experience by ensuring accurate and dynamic rendering of favorite items based on fetched data.

Adds budget and trip retrieval functions
Introduces functions to fetch budgets and trips by user, enhancing data management capabilities within the account dashboard.
This change sets the stage for improved user-specific data handling in future features.

Enhances loading and error handling for activities
Implements loading and error states for the activities page.
Loads activity data asynchronously, displaying a loading indicator while fetching and providing error feedback if the request fails. Updates filters and calculations based on the retrieved data, improving user experience and data integrity.
Relates to issue #123

Adds user-related budget, trip, and favorites retrieval
Implements new functions to retrieve budgets, trips, and favorites for a user.
These additions enhance the user service capabilities, allowing for better data management and user experience.
No existing functionality is broken, ensuring backward compatibility is maintained.

Adds user-related budget, favorites, and trip retrieval methods
Implements new static methods to fetch budgets, user favorites, and trips for a specified user, enhancing user data management capabilities.
These methods utilize caching to improve performance and minimize redundant API calls. Each method simulates fetching data and handles errors gracefully, ensuring a robust user experience.

Adds user metrics for last year and new trip details
Enhances the user service by incorporating metrics for total spending in the last year and introducing fields for favorite destinations, upcoming trips, and recent activities.
These additions aim to provide a more comprehensive view of user engagement and activity, improving the overall functionality of the user service.

Adds new reward activities and improves dashboard layout
Introduces new reward redemption and expired reward entries to enhance user engagement and tracking.
Improves the dashboard layout by refining component structures and styles, ensuring a better user experience across various activities.
Updates the helper function to format days left for better clarity on rewards, and adjusts event handling for activity items.
Enhances visual feedback on activity status with clearer color indications and conditional styling.

Enhances rewards page with user data integration
Updates the rewards page to utilize user-specific data instead of mock data.
Introduces interfaces for reward and activity data structures, improving type safety.
Implements state management for user data, available rewards, and points history.
Adds functionality for redeeming rewards, reflecting changes in points and activity history dynamically.
Improves overall user experience by displaying accurate current points, tier, and redeemable rewards.

Adds trip management and budget overview features
Implements user authentication check for trip visibility, enhancing user experience by prompting login if not authenticated.
Introduces a card-based stats overview displaying total trips, upcoming trips, total spent, and budget progress, providing users with valuable insights into their travel plans and finances.
Includes quick action buttons for planning new trips, accessing the budget calculator, and exploring destinations, streamlining navigation within the app.

Adds history page to view user reward and booking activities
Implements a new history page that allows users to view their bookings, activities, and reward transactions.
Includes filtering and searching capabilities for improved user experience.
Ensures users must be authenticated to access the page, enhancing security.

Refactors badge styles and improves type color handling
Updates badge variants across multiple components for a more consistent design.
Refactors the `getTypeColor` function in various cards to utilize gradient classes instead of background color classes, enhancing visual appeal.
Modifies type definitions from string to Date for check-in and check-out dates in the hotel card to improve data handling.
Improves user interface interactions by adjusting styles and layout properties, ensuring better responsiveness and user experience.

Improves footer icon visibility with text color change
Updates the footer component to enhance the visibility of the globe icon by changing its text color to white, ensuring better contrast against the background gradient.

Enhances badge component with modern styling variants
Improves the badge component by introducing a variety of modern styling options, including gradient, outline, and glass variants for better visual appeal.
Updates sizes and hover effects to enhance user experience, ensuring the component is responsive and visually consistent across different states.
Removes legacy variants for cleaner code and better maintainability.

Adds favorites property to User interface
Introduces a new `favorites` property in the User interface to store user preferences for hotels, flights, tours, destinations, attractions, activities, and vehicles.
This enhancement allows better user personalization and management of favorite items, improving the overall user experience.

Refactors trip layout to enhance UI structure
Improves the layout by introducing a structured grid for displaying trips.
Separates 'My Trips' and 'Past Trips' into distinct columns, enhancing visual clarity. Adds a full-width section for budgets to provide better organization of content.

Implements Past Trips Section with user authentication
Adds a new component to display past trips for authenticated users, enhancing user experience by showing completed trips and total expenses.
Introduces conditional rendering based on user authentication status, with a call to action for users to log in.
Implements a detailed layout for displaying trip information, including options for writing reviews and sharing memories.
Improves overall UI with cards and buttons for better interaction.

Adds BudgetsSection component for managing travel budgets
Implements a new component that allows users to view, filter, and manage their travel budgets.
Users can see overall progress, create new budgets, and access detailed budget statuses. The component enhances user experience by providing a clear interface for tracking financial goals related to travel.
No existing functionality was altered in this addition.

Adds My Trips section and removes Create New Trip page
Introduces a new My Trips section that displays user trips with filtering options for all, upcoming, ongoing, and completed trips.
Removes the redundant Create New Trip page to streamline navigation and improve user experience.
Enhances the overall trip management functionality within the application.

Adds favorites functionality for activities, attractions, and tours
Implements new pages to display saved activities, attractions, and tours for users.
Integrates user authentication checks and dynamically fetches user-specific favorite items. Enhances user experience by providing a clear display of saved items and the ability to manage favorites.
Refactors the layout for better organization and accessibility of favorite items.
Relates to user account dashboard enhancements.

Update hotel IDs and tour categories for clarity
Renames hotel IDs to a standardized format for consistency across the dataset.
Additionally, refines tour categories to enhance organization and improve user navigation.
These changes aim to provide a clearer structure for both hotel and tour data, facilitating better integration and user experience.

Adds mock data for trips and budgets
Introduces mock data for trips and budgets to enhance testing and development processes.
This includes sample trip entries with details such as destination, hotel, and costs, as well as budget entries associated with the trips.
The addition of helper functions facilitates the retrieval of trips and budget statistics, streamlining future development efforts.

Adds image hosts and user favorites data structure
Introduces additional image hosts for asset loading.
Enhances user data model by adding a favorites section, including hotels, vehicles, attractions, destinations, flights, tours, and activities for improved user experience.
Replaces static avatar URLs with dynamic ones from Faker.

Adds new user mock data for testing and development
Introduces two new user entries with detailed attributes, including membership status, rewards, and recent activities.
This enhancement facilitates improved testing and development by providing a more comprehensive dataset.
Adjust padding for user account dropdown menu trigger

Adds user data interface and mock user data
Introduces a new user data interface that defines the structure for user information and adds mock user data for testing purposes.
This change enhances the codebase by providing a consistent format for user data, facilitating easier integration and testing in the application development process.

Adds S3 as an additional image host
Includes "s3.amazonaws.com" in the list of allowed image hosts to support loading images from Amazon S3.
This enhancement improves the flexibility of image sourcing in the application.

Adds user avatar and modifies dashboard layout
Enhances the dashboard by adding a user avatar display alongside the user's name and email for better personalization.
Updates the layout of the bookings section to present monthly and yearly data more clearly, improving overall user experience and information accessibility.

Adds rewards program page with tier benefits and user data
Introduces a new rewards program page that displays tier benefits based on user points.
Includes mock user data to reflect current points and tier status.
Implements a user authentication check to ensure only logged-in users can access the page, redirecting unauthenticated users to the login page.

Adds icons and improves dashboard layout
Implements icon integration for profile, bookings, and rewards sections to enhance visual appeal.
Adjusts badge positioning and adds a button for viewing rewards benefits, improving user navigation and experience.

Adds 'xs' size variant to button styles
Introduces a new 'xs' size variant for buttons, enhancing component flexibility.
This addition allows for smaller buttons, which can improve UI consistency across different screen sizes and use cases.

Improves registration form accessibility and usability
Enhances the registration component by adding `autoComplete` attributes for password fields to improve user experience and security.
Updates the travel interests selection with a more accessible checkbox component, enhancing visual clarity and interaction.
Removes unnecessary complexity in the travel interests display, simplifying the UI while maintaining functionality.

Adds new hotels data for Los Angeles and Singapore
Introduces multiple new hotel entries, enhancing the application’s hotel offerings.
Includes detailed descriptions, amenities, locations, and pricing structures for each new hotel.
Improves user experience by providing a wider range of accommodation options in diverse locations.

Updates button icon hover styles for better visibility
Refines the hover effect on the button's icon variant by removing the background change. This improves clarity and consistency in the button's appearance during interaction.

Removes unused CheckoutPage component
Eliminates the CheckoutPage component as it is no longer needed in the application.
This cleanup helps maintain a lean codebase and improves readability.

Refactors tour link formatting in TourCard component
Improves URL generation for tour links by utilizing the `formatToSlug` utility function, ensuring consistent and clean slugs based on the tour title.
This change enhances maintainability and readability of the code.

Update SelectTrigger width for improved UI layout
Increases the width of the SelectTrigger component from 64 to 80 units.
This change enhances the user interface by providing more space for tour selection, improving overall usability and aesthetics.

Enhances flight details page layout and functionality
Improves the user experience on the flight details page by updating the layout of various sections, including amenities and seat availability.
Adds conditional rendering for seat availability to ensure only available classes are displayed.
Introduces new utility for displaying flight ratings, enhancing the visual representation of flight quality.
Refines text styling for better readability and emphasis throughout the page.
Update hotel city names to "New York City" and add new hotel entries for Cape Town and Cusco
Remove unused discount code functionality from Cart component
Add discount code functionality to CartSummaryPage

Adds new destination entries with detailed information
Incorporates new destinations such as Sydney, Rome, and Santorini, each featuring comprehensive details including geography, climate, attractions, and cultural insights.
Enhances the dataset for better travel recommendations and user experience.

Updates emergencyNumber to be optional in Destination interface
Modifies the Destination interface to make the emergencyNumber property optional.
This change allows for greater flexibility in handling destinations that may not have an emergency number, improving data handling and reducing potential errors.
Add DateTimePicker for date selection in Activities, Hotels, Tours, and Vehicles pages
Refactor DateTimePicker to improve structure and add clear button functionality

Updates input styles in the Login component
Refines the appearance of email and password input fields by adjusting their heights and border styles for improved consistency and usability.
Removes the primary focus styles and replaces them with muted tones to align with the overall design aesthetic.

Removes unused state and improves UI layout
Eliminates the savings plan state as it is no longer needed.
Adjusts the layout of various components for better alignment and user experience, including consistent border styling and spacing adjustments.
Enhances the clarity of UI elements by adding tips for users on budget planning.

Refactors currency context usage in ActivityPanel
Removes duplicate import of the currency context to streamline code.
Updates input styling for better alignment and consistency.
Improves overall code clarity by reducing redundancy.

Update footer input styles for consistency
Improves the styling of the email input field in the footer to align with the design system.
Changes the height and border styles for a more cohesive look across components.

Adds trip itinerary preview and improved sharing functionality
Introduces a preview dialog for trip itineraries, allowing users to review details before sharing or copying.
Enhances the sharing process with better feedback on the button state and error handling for clipboard operations.
Resets button states appropriately when opening the preview and upon sharing actions, improving user experience.

Enhances checkbox styling for terms agreement
Updates the styling of the checkbox components for agreeing to terms and marketing.
Adds a border to improve visibility and consistency across the interface.
This change enhances the user experience by ensuring the checkboxes are clearly defined and visually appealing.

Refines footer styles and improves readability
Removes unnecessary color classes for improved design consistency.
Updates text color classes for better readability and accessibility.
Enhances layout structure while maintaining visual hierarchy.

Enhances UI with border styles for select components
Adds border styles to various select triggers and input fields to improve visual clarity and consistency across the vehicle selection interface.
Refactors the reset button’s styling for better alignment and spacing.
Improves overall user experience by ensuring uniform appearance of interactive elements.

Update pagination and styling for select components
Adjusts the items per page from 9 to 8 for better pagination control.
Improves the styling of select triggers throughout the component by adding border classes for consistency.
Also modifies the reset filters button for improved layout.
These changes enhance user experience and visual consistency.

Fixes checkbox styling for terms acceptance
Updates the checkbox class to properly apply styling for checked state, ensuring consistent appearance with the design guidelines.
Improves user experience by enhancing visual feedback on terms acceptance.

Refactors hotel selection logic and updates filters
Removes unused cart functionality and enhances the hotel filtering mechanism by adjusting default guest counts, star ratings, and price ranges.
Improves user experience by refining input fields for check-in and check-out dates, and updates the styling of selection components for better visibility.
Updates pagination settings to allow for more items per page, improving navigation through hotel listings.

Improves input styling for check-in and check-out fields
Enhances the visual appearance of the date input fields by adding a border to the check-in and check-out inputs.
This change improves user experience by providing clearer input boundaries, ensuring better accessibility and usability.

Enhances UI styling for select components and button
Improves the visual presentation of select components by adding border styles for better consistency and usability.
Updates the button layout to remove extra margins and padding, ensuring a cleaner look in the filter section.
These changes enhance user experience and maintain design uniformity throughout the page.

Update pagination and styling in destinations page
Adjusts the items per page to improve user experience by reducing it from 9 to 8.
Enhances UI consistency by adding border styles to select triggers across various filters, ensuring a uniform look and feel.
Refines filtering logic without altering functionality, maintaining clarity in code.

Improve styling of department selection component
Enhances the visual consistency of the department selection component by adding a border to the SelectTrigger.
This change improves the user interface, making it more visually appealing and aligned with the overall design.

Updates pagination and styling for select components
Reduces items per page from 9 to 8 for improved pagination usability.
Enhances styling of select triggers across multiple filters by adding a border for better visibility.
Adjusts button styling to ensure consistent padding and margin.
Improves overall UI consistency and user experience.

Update pagination and styling for select components
Adjusts items per page from 9 to 8 to improve pagination.
Enhances the styling of select triggers across various filters for consistency by adding border classes.
Modifies the reset filters button for better layout by adjusting margin and padding.

Adds clipboard copy functionality and enhances UI
Implements a copy-to-clipboard feature for trip details, improving user experience by allowing direct copying from the dialog.
Increases the height of the textarea for better visibility of the itinerary and adds visual feedback for successful copy actions.
Enhancements also include new icon imports to represent copy actions.

Enhances trip sharing functionality with detailed output
Improves the trip sharing feature by generating a comprehensive trip summary that includes hotel, dates, guests, and daily itineraries.
Adds a fallback mechanism to allow manual copying of trip details if automatic clipboard access fails, ensuring a better user experience.
Introduces new UI components for displaying manual copy instructions if needed.
Refactors drag-and-drop logic in TripPlannerContainer to improve item handling and ensure unique IDs for new items
